refsect1.title: Object Hierarchy
refsect1.screen: GFlags ╰── GAppInfoCreateFlags GInterface ╰── GAppInfo GObject ╰── GAppLaunchContext

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: GAppInfo and GAppLaunchContext are used for describing and launching applications installed on the system.

As of GLib 2.20, URIs will always be converted to POSIX paths (using g_file_get_path()) when using g_app_info_launch() even if the application requested an URI and not a POSIX path. For example for an desktop-file based application with Exec key totem %U and a single URI, sftp://foo/file.avi, then /home/user/.gvfs/sftp on foo/file.avi will be passed. This will only work if a set of suitable GIO extensions (such as gvfs 2.26 compiled with FUSE support), is available and operational; if this is not the case, the URI will be passed unmodified to the application. Some URIs, such as mailto:, of course cannot be mapped to a POSIX path (in gvfs there's no FUSE mount for it); such URIs will be passed unmodified to the application.

Specifically for gvfs 2.26 and later, the POSIX URI will be mapped back to the GIO URI in the GFile constructors (since gvfs implements the GVfs extension point). As such, if the application needs to examine the URI, it needs to use g_file_get_uri() or similar on GFile. In other words, an application cannot assume that the URI passed to e.g. g_file_new_for_commandline_arg() is equal to the result of g_file_get_uri(). The following snippet illustrates this:

This code will work when both cdda://sr0/Track 1.wav and /home/user/.gvfs/cdda on sr0/Track 1.wav is passed to the application. It should be noted that it's generally not safe for applications to rely on the format of a particular URIs. Different launcher applications (e.g. file managers) may have different ideas of what a given URI means.

refsect2.title: g_app_info_create_from_commandline ()
refsect2.para: Creates a new GAppInfo from the given information.

Note that for commandline , the quoting rules of the Exec key of the freedesktop.org Desktop Entry Specification are applied. For example, if the commandline contains percent-encoded URIs, the percent-character must be doubled in order to prevent it from being swallowed by Exec key unquoting. See the specification for exact quoting rules.

entry.para: the application name, or NULL to use commandline .
flags that can specify details of the created GAppInfo
a GError location to store the error occurring, NULL to ignore.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: new GAppInfo for given command.

refsect2.title: g_app_info_dup ()
refsect2.para: Creates a duplicate of a GAppInfo.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: a duplicate of appinfo .

refsect2.title: g_app_info_equal ()
refsect2.para: Checks if two GAppInfos are equal.

Note that the check <emphasis>may not</emphasis> compare each individual field, and only does an identity check. In case detecting changes in the contents is needed, program code must additionally compare relevant fields.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: TRUE if appinfo1 is equal to appinfo2 . FALSE otherwise.

refsect2.title: g_app_info_get_id ()
refsect2.para: Gets the ID of an application. An id is a string that identifies the application. The exact format of the id is platform dependent. For instance, on Unix this is the desktop file id from the xdg menu specification.
Note that the returned ID may be NULL, depending on how the appinfo has been constructed.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: a string containing the application's ID.

refsect2.title: g_app_info_get_name ()
refsect2.para: Gets the installed name of the application.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: the name of the application for appinfo .

refsect2.title: g_app_info_get_display_name ()
refsect2.para: Gets the display name of the application. The display name is often more descriptive to the user than the name itself.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: the display name of the application for appinfo , or the name if no display name is available.

refsect2.para: Since: 2.24

refsect2.title: g_app_info_get_description ()
refsect2.para: Gets a human-readable description of an installed application.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: a string containing a description of the application appinfo , or NULL if none.

refsect2.title: g_app_info_get_executable ()
refsect2.para: Gets the executable's name for the installed application.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: a string containing the appinfo 's application binaries name.

refsect2.title: g_app_info_get_commandline ()
refsect2.para: Gets the commandline with which the application will be started.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: a string containing the appinfo 's commandline, or NULL if this information is not available.

refsect2.para: Since: 2.20

refsect2.title: g_app_info_get_icon ()
refsect2.para: Gets the icon for the application.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: the default GIcon for appinfo or NULL if there is no default icon.

refsect2.title: g_app_info_launch ()
refsect2.para: Launches the application. Passes files to the launched application as arguments, using the optional context to get information about the details of the launcher (like what screen it is on). On error, error will be set accordingly.
To launch the application without arguments pass a NULL files list.
Note that even if the launch is successful the application launched can fail to start if it runs into problems during startup. There is no way to detect this.

Some URIs can be changed when passed through a GFile (for instance unsupported URIs with strange formats like mailto:), so if you have a textual URI you want to pass in as argument, consider using g_app_info_launch_uris() instead.
The launched application inherits the environment of the launching process, but it can be modified with g_app_launch_context_setenv() and g_app_launch_context_unsetenv().

On UNIX, this function sets the GIO_LAUNCHED_DESKTOP_FILE environment variable with the path of the launched desktop file and GIO_LAUNCHED_DESKTOP_FILE_PID to the process id of the launched process. This can be used to ignore GIO_LAUNCHED_DESKTOP_FILE, should it be inherited by further processes. The DISPLAY and DESKTOP_STARTUP_ID environment variables are also set, based on information provided in context .

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: TRUE on successful launch, FALSE otherwise.

refsect2.title: g_app_info_supports_files ()
refsect2.para: Checks if the application accepts files as arguments.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: TRUE if the appinfo supports files.

refsect2.title: g_app_info_supports_uris ()
refsect2.para: Checks if the application supports reading files and directories from URIs.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: TRUE if the appinfo supports URIs.

refsect2.title: g_app_info_launch_uris ()
refsect2.para: Launches the application. This passes the uris to the launched application as arguments, using the optional context to get information about the details of the launcher (like what screen it is on). On error, error will be set accordingly.
To launch the application without arguments pass a NULL uris list.
Note that even if the launch is successful the application launched can fail to start if it runs into problems during startup. There is no way to detect this.

entry.para: a GList containing URIs to launch.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: TRUE on successful launch, FALSE otherwise.

refsect2.title: g_app_info_should_show ()
refsect2.para: Checks if the application info should be shown in menus that list available applications.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: TRUE if the appinfo should be shown, FALSE otherwise.

refsect2.title: g_app_info_can_delete ()
refsect2.para: Obtains the information whether the GAppInfo can be deleted. See g_app_info_delete().

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: TRUE if appinfo can be deleted

refsect2.para: Since: 2.20

refsect2.title: g_app_info_delete ()
refsect2.para: Tries to delete a GAppInfo.
On some platforms, there may be a difference between user-defined GAppInfos which can be deleted, and system-wide ones which cannot. See g_app_info_can_delete().
Virtual: do_delete

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: TRUE if appinfo has been deleted

refsect2.para: Since: 2.20

refsect2.title: g_app_info_reset_type_associations ()
refsect2.para: Removes all changes to the type associations done by g_app_info_set_as_default_for_type(), g_app_info_set_as_default_for_extension(), g_app_info_add_supports_type() or g_app_info_remove_supports_type().
Since: 2.20

refsect2.title: g_app_info_set_as_default_for_type ()
refsect2.para: Sets the application as the default handler for a given type.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: TRUE on success, FALSE on error.

refsect2.title: g_app_info_set_as_default_for_extension ()
refsect2.para: Sets the application as the default handler for the given file extension.

entry.para: a string containing the file extension (without the dot).

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: TRUE on success, FALSE on error.

refsect2.title: g_app_info_set_as_last_used_for_type ()
refsect2.para: Sets the application as the last used application for a given type. This will make the application appear as first in the list returned by g_app_info_get_recommended_for_type(), regardless of the default application for that content type.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: TRUE on success, FALSE on error.

refsect2.title: g_app_info_add_supports_type ()
refsect2.para: Adds a content type to the application information to indicate the application is capable of opening files with the given content type.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: TRUE on success, FALSE on error.

refsect2.title: g_app_info_can_remove_supports_type ()
refsect2.para: Checks if a supported content type can be removed from an application.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: TRUE if it is possible to remove supported content types from a given appinfo , FALSE if not.

refsect2.title: g_app_info_remove_supports_type ()
refsect2.para: Removes a supported type from an application, if possible.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: TRUE on success, FALSE on error.

refsect2.title: g_app_info_get_supported_types ()
refsect2.para: Retrieves the list of content types that app_info claims to support. If this information is not provided by the environment, this function will return NULL. This function does not take in consideration associations added with g_app_info_add_supports_type(), but only those exported directly by the application.

entry.para: a GAppInfo that can handle files

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: a list of content types.

refsect2.para: Since: 2.34

refsect2.title: g_app_info_get_all ()
refsect2.para: Gets a list of all of the applications currently registered on this system.

For desktop files, this includes applications that have NoDisplay=true set or are excluded from display by means of OnlyShowIn or NotShowIn. See g_app_info_should_show(). The returned list does not include applications which have the Hidden key set.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: a newly allocated GList of references to GAppInfos.

refsect2.title: g_app_info_get_all_for_type ()
refsect2.para: Gets a list of all GAppInfos for a given content type, including the recommended and fallback GAppInfos. See g_app_info_get_recommended_for_type() and g_app_info_get_fallback_for_type().

entry.para: the content type to find a GAppInfo for

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: GList of GAppInfos for given content_type or NULL on error.

refsect2.title: g_app_info_get_default_for_type ()
refsect2.para: Gets the default GAppInfo for a given content type.

entry.para: the content type to find a GAppInfo for
if TRUE, the GAppInfo is expected to support URIs

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: GAppInfo for given content_type or NULL on error.

refsect2.title: g_app_info_get_default_for_uri_scheme ()
refsect2.para: Gets the default application for handling URIs with the given URI scheme. A URI scheme is the initial part of the URI, up to but not including the ':', e.g. "http", "ftp" or "sip".

entry.para: a string containing a URI scheme.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: GAppInfo for given uri_scheme or NULL on error.

refsect2.title: g_app_info_get_fallback_for_type ()
refsect2.para: Gets a list of fallback GAppInfos for a given content type, i.e. those applications which claim to support the given content type by MIME type subclassing and not directly.

entry.para: the content type to find a GAppInfo for

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: GList of GAppInfos for given content_type or NULL on error.

refsect2.para: Since: 2.28

refsect2.title: g_app_info_get_recommended_for_type ()
refsect2.para: Gets a list of recommended GAppInfos for a given content type, i.e. those applications which claim to support the given content type exactly, and not by MIME type subclassing. Note that the first application of the list is the last used one, i.e. the last one for which g_app_info_set_as_last_used_for_type() has been called.

entry.para: the content type to find a GAppInfo for

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: GList of GAppInfos for given content_type or NULL on error.

refsect2.para: Since: 2.28

refsect2.title: g_app_info_launch_default_for_uri ()
refsect2.para: Utility function that launches the default application registered to handle the specified uri. Synchronous I/O is done on the uri to detect the type of the file if required.

entry.para: return location for an error, or NULL.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: TRUE on success, FALSE on error.

refsect2.title: g_app_info_launch_default_for_uri_async ()
refsect2.programlisting: void g_app_info_launch_default_for_uri_async (const char *uri, GAppLaunchContext *context, GCancellable *cancellable, GAsyncReadyCallback callback, gpointer user_data);
refsect2.para: Async version of g_app_info_launch_default_for_uri().
This version is useful if you are interested in receiving error information in the case where the application is sandboxed and the portal may present an application chooser dialog to the user.

entry.para: a GASyncReadyCallback to call when the request is done.

refsect2.para: Since: 2.50

refsect2.title: g_app_info_launch_default_for_uri_finish ()
refsect2.para: Finishes an asynchronous launch-default-for-uri operation.

entry.para: return location for an error, or NULL.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: TRUE if the launch was successful, FALSE if error is set

refsect2.para: Since: 2.50

refsect2.title: g_app_launch_context_setenv ()
refsect2.para: Arranges for variable to be set to value in the child's environment when context is used to launch an application.

entry.para: the value for to set the variable to.

refsect2.para: Since: 2.32

refsect2.title: g_app_launch_context_unsetenv ()
refsect2.para: Arranges for variable to be unset in the child's environment when context is used to launch an application.
Since: 2.32

refsect2.title: g_app_launch_context_get_environment ()
refsect2.para: Gets the complete environment variable list to be passed to the child process when context is used to launch an application. This is a NULL-terminated array of strings, where each string has the form KEY=VALUE.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: the child's environment.

refsect2.para: Since: 2.32

refsect2.title: g_app_launch_context_get_display ()
refsect2.para: Gets the display string for the context . This is used to ensure new applications are started on the same display as the launching application, by setting the DISPLAY environment variable.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: a display string for the display.

refsect2.title: g_app_launch_context_get_startup_notify_id ()
refsect2.para: Initiates startup notification for the application and returns the DESKTOP_STARTUP_ID for the launched operation, if supported.
Startup notification IDs are defined in the [FreeDesktop.Org Startup Notifications standard](http://standards.freedesktop.org/startup-notification-spec/startup-notification-latest.txt").

entry.para: a GList of of GFile objects.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: a startup notification ID for the application, or NULL if not supported.

refsect2.title: g_app_launch_context_launch_failed ()
refsect2.para: Called when an application has failed to launch, so that it can cancel the application startup notification started in g_app_launch_context_get_startup_notify_id().

entry.para: the startup notification id that was returned by g_app_launch_context_get_startup_notify_id().

refsect2.title: g_app_launch_context_new ()
refsect2.para: Creates a new application launch context. This is not normally used, instead you instantiate a subclass of this, such as GdkAppLaunchContext.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: a GAppLaunchContext.

refsect2.title: enum GAppInfoCreateFlags
refsect2.para: Flags used when creating a GAppInfo.

entry.para: Application opens in a terminal window.

refsect2.title: GAppInfo
refsect2.para: Information about an installed application and methods to launch it (with file arguments).

refsect2.title: struct GAppInfoIface
refsect2.para: Application Information interface, for operating system portability.

entry.para: Gets a string identifier for a GAppInfo.
Gets the name of the application for a GAppInfo.
Gets a short description for the application described by the GAppInfo.
Gets the executable name for the GAppInfo.
Gets the GIcon for the GAppInfo.
Launches an application specified by the GAppInfo.
Indicates whether the application specified supports launching URIs.
Indicates whether the application specified accepts filename arguments.
Launches an application with a list of URIs.
Returns whether an application should be shown (e.g. when getting a list of installed applications). FreeDesktop.Org Startup Notification Specification.
Sets an application as default for a given content type.
Sets an application as default for a given file extension.
Adds to the GAppInfo information about supported file types.
Checks for support for removing supported file types from a GAppInfo.
Removes a supported application type from a GAppInfo.
Checks if a GAppInfo can be deleted. Since 2.20
Gets the commandline for the GAppInfo. Since 2.20
Gets the display name for the GAppInfo. Since 2.24
Sets the application as the last used. See g_app_info_set_as_last_used_for_type().
Retrieves the list of content types that app_info claims to support.

refsect2.title: GAppLaunchContext
refsect2.para: Integrating the launch with the launching application. This is used to handle for instance startup notification and launching the new application on the same screen as the launching window.

refsect2.title: The launch-failed signal
refsect2.para: The ::launch-failed signal is emitted when a GAppInfo launch fails. The startup notification id is provided, so that the launcher can cancel the startup notification.

entry.para: the startup notification id for the failed launch

entry.simpara: user data set when the signal handler was connected.

refsect2.para: Flags: Run Last
Since: 2.36

refsect2.title: The launched signal
refsect2.programlisting: void user_function (GAppLaunchContext *context, GAppInfo *info, GVariant *platform_data, gpointer user_data)
refsect2.para: The ::launched signal is emitted when a GAppInfo is successfully launched. The platform_data is an GVariant dictionary mapping strings to variants (ie a{sv}), which contains additional, platform-specific data about this launch. On UNIX, at least the "pid" and "startup-notification-id" keys will be present.

entry.para: the GAppInfo that was just launched
additional platform-specific data for this launch

entry.simpara: user data set when the signal handler was connected.

refsect2.para: Flags: Run Last
Since: 2.36
